line.token: * This file is part of the Symfony package.
* For the full copyright and license information, please view the LICENSE
* file that was distributed with this source code.
* Parser parses YAML strings to convert them to PHP arrays.
* @param int $offset The offset of YAML document (used for line numbers in error messages)
* @param int|null $totalNumberOfLines The overall number of lines being parsed
* @param int[] $skippedLineNumbers Number of comment lines that have been skipped by the parser
* Parses a YAML string to a PHP value.
* @param int $flags A bit field of PARSE_* constants to customize the YAML parser behavior
* @throws ParseException If the YAML is not valid
'Passing a boolean flag to toggle exception handling is deprecated since version 3.1 and will be removed in 4.0. Use the Yaml::PARSE_EXCEPTION_ON_INVALID_TYPE flag instead.'
'Passing a boolean flag to toggle object support is deprecated since version 3.1 and will be removed in 4.0. Use the Yaml::PARSE_OBJECT flag instead.'
'Passing a boolean flag to toggle object for map support is deprecated since version 3.1 and will be removed in 4.0. Use the Yaml::PARSE_OBJECT_FOR_MAP flag instead.'
'The YAML value does not appear to be valid UTF-8.'
'A YAML file cannot contain tabs as indentation.'
'You cannot define a sequence item when in a mapping'
// this is a compact notation element, add to next block and parse
'You cannot define a mapping item when in a sequence'
// Convert float keys to strings, to avoid being converted to integers by PHP
'YAML merge keys used with a scalar value instead of an array.'
'YAML merge keys used with a scalar value instead of an array.'
// If the value associated with the merge key is a sequence, then this sequence is expected to contain mapping nodes
// and each of these nodes is merged in turn according to its order in the sequence. Keys in mapping nodes earlier
// in the sequence override keys specified in later mapping nodes.
// If the value associated with the key is a single mapping node, each of its key/value pairs is inserted into the
// current mapping, unless the key already exists in it.
// if next line is less indented or equal, then it means that the current value is null
// Spec: Keys MUST be unique; first one wins.
// But overwriting is allowed when a merge node is used in current block.
// Spec: Keys MUST be unique; first one wins.
// But overwriting is allowed when a merge node is used in current block.
// Spec: Keys MUST be unique; first one wins.
// But overwriting is allowed when a merge node is used in current block.
'Offset doesn\'t correspond to the begin of a valid UTF-8 code point.'
* Returns the current line number (takes the offset into account).
* Returns the next embed block of YAML.
* @param int $indentation The indent level at which the block is to be read, or null for default
* @param bool $inSequence True if the enclosing data structure is a sequence
* @throws ParseException When indentation problem are detected
// the previous line contained a dash but no item content, this line is a sequence item with the same indentation
// and therefore no nested list or mapping
// terminate all block scalars that are more indented than the current line
// we ignore "comment" lines only when we are not inside a scalar block
// remember ignored comment lines (they are used later in nested
// parser calls to determine real line numbers)
// CAUTION: beware to not populate the global property here as it
// will otherwise influence the getRealCurrentLineNb() call here
// for consecutive comment lines and subsequent embedded blocks
* Moves the parser to the next line.
* Moves the parser to the previous line.
* @param int $flags A bit field of PARSE_* constants to customize the YAML parser behavior
* @param string $context The parser context (either sequence or mapping)
* @throws ParseException When reference does not exist
'A colon cannot be used in an unquoted mapping value.'
* @param string $style The style indicator that was used to begin this block scalar (| or >)
* @param string $chomping The chomping indicator that was used to begin this block scalar (+ or -)
* @param int $indentation The indentation indicator that was used to begin this block scalar
// leading blank lines are consumed before determining indentation
* Returns true if the next line is indented.
* @return bool Returns true if the next line is indented, false otherwise
* Returns true if the current line is blank or if it is a comment line.
* @return bool Returns true if the current line is empty or if it is a comment line, false otherwise
* Returns true if the current line is blank.
* @return bool Returns true if the current line is blank, false otherwise
* Returns true if the current line is a comment line.
* @return bool Returns true if the current line is a comment line, false otherwise
//checking explicitly the first char of the trim is faster than loops or strpos
* Cleanups a YAML string to be parsed.
* @return string A cleaned up YAML string
// items have been removed, update the offset
// remove start of the document marker (---)
// items have been removed, update the offset
// remove end of the document marker (...)
* Returns true if the next line starts unindented collection.
* @return bool Returns true if the next line starts unindented collection, false otherwise
* Returns true if the string is un-indented collection item.
* @return bool Returns true if the string is un-indented collection item, false otherwise
* Tests whether or not the current line is the header of a block scalar.
